decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Lucky Clover and Omnath, Locus of Creation. The deck also includes control elements with Fae of Wishes and Brazen Borrower to provide flexibility and disruption to the opponent's game plan. Edgewall Innkeeper and Escape to the Wilds provide card advantage and the ability to dig deeper into the deck for key pieces. The deck also features a strong creature package with Beanstalk Giant and Lovestruck Beast for board presence and Bonecrusher Giant for removal.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays utilizing low-cost creatures and efficient removal spells to maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to quickly build a board presence with threats like Bonecrusher Giant, Kroxa, and Magmatic Channeler, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Bloodchief's Thirst and Heartless Act. Liliana, Waker of the Dead and Tymaret Calls the Dead provide additional value and card advantage, allowing the deck to maintain momentum and finish off the opponent with powerful flyers like Rankle, Master of Pranks and Nighthawk Scavenger.

This deck focuses on using powerful control spells and enchantments to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating value with cards like Dance of the Manse and Yorion, Sky Nomad. The deck aims to stall the game with board wipes like Shatter the Sky and Doom Foretold, while also having the ability to counter opposing spells with Mystical Dispute. The synergies between enchantments like Treacherous Blessing and Confounding Conundrum allow for card advantage and incremental advantage. The deck's mana base ensures consistency and flexibility in casting its spells.

This deck focuses on aggressively deploying threats and disrupting the opponent's board. By utilizing a combination of efficient creatures like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Bonecrusher Giant, along with removal spells like Heartless Act and Shredded Sails, the goal is to keep the pressure on and maintain control of the battlefield. Additionally, cards like Rankle, Master of Pranks and Ox of Agonas provide card advantage and extra reach to close out games quickly. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early on and secure a decisive victory.

This Dimir Aggro deck focuses on using efficient creatures with disruptive abilities like Rankle, Master of Pranks and Thieves' Guild Enforcer to apply pressure on the opponent. By combining evasion with card advantage and disruption, the deck aims to control the board while chipping away at the opponent's life total. The inclusion of versatile spells like Drown in the Loch and Heartless Act allows for interaction with the opponent's threats, while cards like Soaring Thought-Thief and Zareth San, the Trickster provide additional aggression and evasion. The deck's mana base includes a mix of dual lands and utility lands to ensure consistent access to all colors of mana.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful combat tricks to quickly bring your opponent's life total to zero. By utilizing the efficient creatures and removal spells in the Gruul color combination, you aim to curve out smoothly and maintain pressure on your opponent throughout the game. The deck also includes cards like The Great Henge to provide card advantage and additional resources as the game progresses. Overall, the strategy revolves around fast and aggressive gameplay to secure victory.

This deck focuses on fast and aggressive plays with a mix of powerful creatures and spells to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By utilizing a combination of efficient creatures like Robber of the Rich and Questing Beast, along with strong finishers like Embercleave, the deck aims to close out games before the opponent can stabilize. The inclusion of ramp cards like Ilysian Caryatid and big threats like Elder Gargaroth also provides added versatility and resilience to ensure consistent pressure on the opponent. The mana base is optimized for quick and smooth mana development to support the deck's aggressive strategy.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful cards like Omnath, Locus of Creation and Escape to the Wilds. It utilizes cards like Beanstalk Giant and Lucky Clover to generate extra mana and card advantage. Control elements are included with cards like Brazen Borrower and Giant Killer to manage the board and keep the opponent's threats in check. Fae of Wishes is used to tutor for specific answers from the sideboard, making this deck versatile and adaptable to various situations. Overall, the goal is to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent while accelerating into powerful plays.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly apply pressure to the opponent through aggressive creatures and utilize adventure cards for additional value. By utilizing cards like Lucky Clover and Edgewall Innkeeper in combination with adventure creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Brazen Borrower, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats. Additionally, Escape to the Wilds allows for card advantage and tempo plays, while Fae of Wishes provides flexibility in accessing sideboard options. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's color requirements for smooth gameplay.

The deck focuses on utilizing adventure creatures and spells to ramp up mana quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful spell effects. By leveraging cards like Lucky Clover, Edgewall Innkeeper, and Fae of Wishes, the deck can generate extra value and advantage, while also having access to a wide range of versatile options thanks to adventure spells. The key strategy is to establish early board presence, maintain tempo, and close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through counter spells and removal while generating card advantage through card draw and repeatable effects. It aims to control the board with versatile removal spells like Heartless Act and Extinction Event, as well as powerful threats like Ashiok, Nightmare Muse and Shark Typhoon. The deck also utilizes Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger to apply pressure on the opponent's hand and graveyard. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes flexible lands like Fabled Passage and pathways. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a long game.

The primary focus of this Gruul Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and combat tricks. It utilizes efficient creatures like Rimrock Knight, Questing Beast, and Lovestruck Beast to apply pressure early on, while also benefiting from the card advantage provided by Edgewall Innkeeper. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells such as Primal Might and Spikefield Hazard to deal with opposing threats, as well as the powerful finisher Embercleave to secure victory in combat.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish board presence and apply pressure on the opponent with efficient and powerful creatures. By utilizing a combination of mana acceleration and versatile removal spells, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like The Great Henge and Castle Garenbrig provide additional value and resilience to ensure the deck can maintain its aggressive strategy throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to ramp up quickly with cards like Beanstalk Giant and Omnath, Locus of Creation to gain a resource advantage over the opponent. Using Lucky Clover to double up on spell effects and Fae of Wishes to search for specific answers, the deck aims to control the game by generating card advantage and tempo. Additionally, cards like Bonecrusher Giant and Brazen Borrower provide disruption and removal options to further assert dominance and outvalue the opponent. The overarching strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful spells and creatures while maintaining control of the game state.

The deck aims to control the game by ramping quickly with cards like Lotus Cobra and Cultivate to play big threats like Omnath, Locus of Creation and Genesis Ultimatum. Ruin Crab helps to mill the opponent's deck while Glasspool Mimic provides additional value. Ugin, the Spirit Dragon serves as a powerful board wipe option and Felidar Retreat can generate large tokens. Overall, the deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana to overwhelm the opponent with powerful spells and creatures while maintaining control of the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and removal spells to constantly pressure the opponent and control the board. By using cards like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Bonecrusher Giant to deal damage to the opponent, while also using removal spells like Bloodchief's Thirst and Heartless Act to eliminate threats, the deck aims to close out the game quickly and efficiently. Additionally, cards like Tymaret Calls the Dead and Liliana, Waker of the Dead provide additional value and card advantage to keep the aggression going.
